item.title: Lesley add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "If there is no love in the world, we will make a new world, and we will give it walls, and we will furnish it with soft, red interiors, from the inside out, and give it a knocker that resonates like a diamond falling to a jeweller's felt so that we should never hear it. Love me, because love doesn't exist, and I have tried everything that does." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "If we, citizens, do not support our artists, then we sacrifice our imagination on the altar of crude reality and we end up believing in nothing and having worthless dreams." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "I must say a word about fear. It is life's only true opponent. Only fear can defeat life. It is a clever, treacherous adversary, how well I know. It has no decency, respects no law or convention, shows no mercy. It goes for your weakest spot, which it finds with unnerving ease. It begins in your mind, always ... so you must fight hard to express it. You must fight hard to shine the light of words upon it. Because if you don't, if your fear becomes a wordless darkness that you avoid, perhaps even manage to forget, you open yourself to further attacks of fear because you never truly fought the opponent who defeated you." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Some may never live, but the crazy never die." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "No sympathy for the devil; keep that in mind. Buy the ticket, take the ride...and if it occasionally gets a little heavier than what you had in mind, well...maybe chalk it off to forced conscious expansion: Tune in, freak out, get beaten." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description:
"All my life, my heart has sought a thing I cannot name.
Remembered line from a long- forgotten poem" -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Live, travel, adventure, bless, and don't be sorry." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Boys and girls in America have such a sad time together; sophistication demands that they submit to sex immediately without proper preliminary talk. Not courting talk â€” real straight talk about souls, for life is holy and every moment is precious." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "There was nowhere to go but everywhere, so just keep on rolling under the stars." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "I hope it is true that a man can die and yet not only live in others but give them life, and not only life, but that great consciousness of life." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "But why think about that when all the golden lands ahead of you and all kinds of unforseen events wait lurking to surprise you and make you glad you're alive to see?" -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Our battered suitcases were piled on the sidewalk again; we had longer ways to go. But no matter, the road is life" -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "The air was soft, the stars so fine, the promise of every cobbled alley so great, that I thought I was in a dream." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "The yard was full of tomato plants about to ripen, and mint, mint, everything smelling of mint, and one fine old tree that I loved to sit under on those cool perfect starry California October nights unmatched anywhere in the world." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Lesley add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
